snippet: A judge fined Johnson & Johnson and a subsidiary after a jury found that the companies minimized or concealed the dangers associated with Risperdal, an antipsychotic drug.
abstract: Arkansas Judge Tim Fox fines Johnson & Johnson and its subsidiary Janssen Pharmaceuticals more than $1.2 billion after a jury found that the companies minimized or concealed the dangers associated with antipsychotic drug Risperdal.
lead_paragraph: A judge fined Johnson & Johnson and a subsidiary after a jury found that the companies minimized or concealed the dangers associated with Risperdal, an antipsychotic drug.
